thread.title: Global Automotive Retrofit EV Powertrain Market Set to Surge

author: MAXIMIZE MARKET RESEARCH PVT. LTD
title: Global Automotive Retrofit EV Powertrain Market Set to Surge
text:
Global Automotive Retrofit EV Powertrain Market Set to Surge by 2030 01-10-2025 07:18 AM CET | Advertising, Media Consulting, Marketing Research
Press release from: MAXIMIZE MARKET RESEARCH PVT. LTD
ð†ð¥ð¨ð›ðšð¥ ð€ð®ð­ð¨ð¦ð¨ð­ð¢ð¯ðž ð‘ðžð­ð«ð¨ðŸð¢ð­ ð„ð¥ðžðœð­ð«ð¢ðœ ð•ðžð¡ð¢ðœð¥ðž ðð¨ð°ðžð«ð­ð«ðšð¢ð§ ðŒðšð«ð¤ðžð­ ðð¨ð¢ð¬ðžð ðŸð¨ð« ð’ð¢ð ð§ð¢ðŸð¢ðœðšð§ð­ ð†ð«ð¨ð°ð­ð¡
The global automotive retrofit electric vehicle (EV) powertrain market is on a robust growth trajectory, driven by stringent emission regulations, rising fuel costs, and increasing consumer demand for cost-effective electric mobility solutions.The size of the automotive retrofit electric vehicle power train market was estimated at US$67.64 billion in 2023, and it is anticipated that total revenue will increase at a rate of 7.2% from 2024 to 2030, reaching around US$110.04 billion.
ð†ð¥ð¨ð›ðšð¥ ð€ð®ð­ð¨ð¦ð¨ð­ð¢ð¯ðž ð‘ðžð­ð«ð¨ðŸð¢ð­ ð„ð¥ðžðœð­ð«ð¢ðœ ð•ðžð¡ð¢ðœð¥ðž ðð¨ð°ðžð« ð­ð«ðšð¢ð§ ðŒðšð«ð¤ðžð­ ðƒð²ð§ðšð¦ð¢ðœð¬
The transition from internal combustion engine (ICE) vehicles to electric vehicles is accelerating globally. Retrofitting existing vehicles with electric powertrains offers a cost-effective alternative to purchasing new EVs, enabling consumers to contribute to environmental sustainability without incurring the higher costs associated with new vehicle purchases. Government incentives and policies promoting electric mobility further bolster this trend.

ð†ð¥ð¨ð›ðšð¥ ð€ð®ð­ð¨ð¦ð¨ð­ð¢ð¯ðž ð‘ðžð­ð«ð¨ðŸð¢ð­ ð„ð¥ðžðœð­ð«ð¢ðœ ð•ðžð¡ð¢ðœð¥ðž ðð¨ð°ðžð« ð­ð«ðšð¢ð§ ðŒðšð«ð¤ðžð­ ð•ð¢ðžð­ð§ðšð¦: ðŽð©ð©ð¨ð«ð­ð®ð§ð¢ð­ð¢ðžð¬ ð¢ð§ ð„ð¥ðžðœð­ð«ð¢ðœ ðŒð¨ð›ð¢ð¥ð¢ð­ð²
Vietnam is witnessing a surge in electric vehicle adoption, creating opportunities for retrofit solutions. Local companies are exploring partnerships to enhance EV infrastructure and services, aiming to meet the growing demand for sustainable transportation.
ð†ð¥ð¨ð›ðšð¥ ð€ð®ð­ð¨ð¦ð¨ð­ð¢ð¯ðž ð‘ðžð­ð«ð¨ðŸð¢ð­ ð„ð¥ðžðœð­ð«ð¢ðœ ð•ðžð¡ð¢ðœð¥ðž ðð¨ð°ðžð« ð­ð«ðšð¢ð§ ðŒðšð«ð¤ðžð­ ð“ð¡ðšð¢ð¥ðšð§ð: ð†ð«ð¨ð°ð­ð¡ ð¢ð§ ð„ð• ðŒðšð«ð¤ðžð­
Thailand's EV market is expanding rapidly, with significant investments from international players. Notably, China's BYD acquired a 20% stake in Thai dealer Rever Automotive, its local distributor, to strengthen its presence in the region. This strategic move aligns with Thailand's goal to become a regional hub for electric vehicles.
ð†ð¥ð¨ð›ðšð¥ ð€ð®ð­ð¨ð¦ð¨ð­ð¢ð¯ðž ð‘ðžð­ð«ð¨ðŸð¢ð­ ð„ð¥ðžðœð­ð«ð¢ðœ ð•ðžð¡ð¢ðœð¥ðž ðð¨ð°ðžð« ð­ð«ðšð¢ð§ ðŒðšð«ð¤ðžð­ ð‰ðšð©ðšð§: ð‚ð¨ð§ð¬ð¨ð¥ð¢ððšð­ð¢ð¨ð§ ð¢ð§ ð­ð¡ðž ð€ð®ð­ð¨ð¦ð¨ð­ð¢ð¯ðž ðˆð§ðð®ð¬ð­ð«ð²
In December 2024, Japanese automakers Honda Motor and Nissan Motor initiated merger talks to address increasing competition from global EV manufacturers. This potential consolidation aims to streamline operations and accelerate EV development, positioning the combined entity to better compete in the evolving automotive landscape.
ð†ð¥ð¨ð›ðšð¥ ð€ð®ð­ð¨ð¦ð¨ð­ð¢ð¯ðž ð‘ðžð­ð«ð¨ðŸð¢ð­ ð„ð¥ðžðœð­ð«ð¢ðœ ð•ðžð¡ð¢ðœð¥ðž ðð¨ð°ðžð« ð­ð«ðšð¢ð§ ðŒðšð«ð¤ðžð­ ð’ð¨ð®ð­ð¡ ðŠð¨ð«ðžðš: ð“ð«ðžð§ðð¬ ð¢ð§ ð„ð• ð€ðð¨ð©ð­ð¢ð¨ð§
South Korea continues to advance in EV adoption, with local manufacturers and suppliers focusing on developing retrofit solutions to cater to the growing demand for electric mobility. The government's supportive policies and investments in EV infrastructure are facilitating this transition.
ð†ð¥ð¨ð›ðšð¥ ð€ð®ð­ð¨ð¦ð¨ð­ð¢ð¯ðž ð‘ðžð­ð«ð¨ðŸð¢ð­ ð„ð¥ðžðœð­ð«ð¢ðœ ð•ðžð¡ð¢ðœð¥ðž ðð¨ð°ðžð« ð­ð«ðšð¢ð§ ðŒðšð«ð¤ðžð­ ð’ð¢ð§ð ðšð©ð¨ð«ðž: ðŽð©ð©ð¨ð«ð­ð®ð§ð¢ð­ð¢ðžð¬ ð¢ð§ ð’ð®ð¬ð­ðšð¢ð§ðšð›ð¥ðž ð“ð«ðšð§ð¬ð©ð¨ð«ð­
Singapore is actively promoting sustainable transport solutions, including the adoption of electric vehicles. The government's initiatives to expand EV infrastructure and provide incentives for EV adoption are creating opportunities for retrofit solutions in the market.
ð†ð¥ð¨ð›ðšð¥ ð€ð®ð­ð¨ð¦ð¨ð­ð¢ð¯ðž ð‘ðžð­ð«ð¨ðŸð¢ð­ ð„ð¥ðžðœð­ð«ð¢ðœ ð•ðžð¡ð¢ðœð¥ðž ðð¨ð°ðžð« ð­ð«ðšð¢ð§ ðŒðšð«ð¤ðžð­ ð”ð§ð¢ð­ðžð ð’ð­ðšð­ðžð¬: ð†ð«ð¨ð°ð­ð¡ ð¢ð§ ð‘ðžð­ð«ð¨ðŸð¢ð­ ð’ð¨ð¥ð®ð­ð¢ð¨ð§ð¬
The U.S. market for automotive retrofit electric vehicle powertrains is experiencing significant growth, with projections indicating a market size surpassing USD 210.15 billion by 2033, expanding at a solid CAGR of 12.51%. Companies like XL Fleet Corp are actively contributing to this growth through strategic acquisitions and the provision of subscription-based solutions for EV conversions.
ð†ð¥ð¨ð›ðšð¥ ð€ð®ð­ð¨ð¦ð¨ð­ð¢ð¯ðž ð‘ðžð­ð«ð¨ðŸð¢ð­ ð„ð¥ðžðœð­ð«ð¢ðœ ð•ðžð¡ð¢ðœð¥ðž ðð¨ð°ðžð« ð­ð«ðšð¢ð§ ðŒðšð«ð¤ðžð­ ð„ð®ð«ð¨ð©ðž: ð“ð«ðžð§ðð¬ ð¢ð§ ð„ð¥ðžðœð­ð«ð¢ðœ ð•ðžð¡ð¢ðœð¥ðž ð‘ðžð­ð«ð¨ðŸð¢ð­ð­ð¢ð§ð 
Europe remains at the forefront of EV adoption, with a growing emphasis on retrofitting existing vehicles to meet stringent emission standards. The market is witnessing a surge in investments, mergers, and acquisitions, shaping the competitive landscape and driving innovation in retrofit solutions.

The global automotive retrofit electric vehicle powertrain market is set for substantial growth, driven by technological advancements, supportive government policies, and increasing consumer awareness of environmental sustainability. As countries and companies continue to invest in electric mobility, retrofit solutions will play a pivotal role in the transition towards a greener automotive future.
